info.title: Shopware Admin API
info.description:
This endpoint reference contains an overview of all endpoints comprising the Shopware Admin API.

For a better overview, all CRUD-endpoints are hidden by default. If you want to show also CRUD-endpoints
add the query parameter `type=jsonapi`.

get.description: Loads a list of PayPal disputes

parameters.name: salesChannelId
parameters.description: ID of the sales channel to which the disputes belong

parameters.name: disputeStateFilter
parameters.description: Filter for dispute state. Seperate multiple states with a comma. Must one of these values: Swag\PayPal\RestApi\V1\Api\Disputes\Item::DISPUTE_STATES

get.description: Loads the dispute details of the given PayPal dispute ID

parameters.name: salesChannelId
parameters.description: ID of the sales channel to which the dispute belongs

get.description: Loads the order details of the given PayPal order ID

parameters.name: orderTransactionId
parameters.description: ID of the order transaction which contains the PayPal payment

get.description: Loads the authorization details of the given PayPal authorization ID

parameters.name: orderTransactionId
parameters.description: ID of the order transaction which contains the PayPal payment

get.description: Loads the capture details of the given PayPal capture ID

parameters.name: orderTransactionId
parameters.description: ID of the order transaction which contains the PayPal payment

get.description: Loads the refund details of the given PayPal refund ID

parameters.name: orderTransactionId
parameters.description: ID of the order transaction which contains the PayPal payment

post.description: Refunds the PayPal capture and sets the state of the Shopware order transaction accordingly

parameters.name: orderTransactionId
parameters.description: ID of the order transaction which contains the PayPal payment

noteToPayer.description: A note to the payer sent with the refund

post.description: Captures the PayPal authorization and sets the state of the Shopware order transaction accordingly

parameters.name: orderTransactionId
parameters.description: ID of the order transaction which contains the PayPal payment

noteToPayer.description: A note to the payer sent with the capture

isFinal.description: Define if this is the final capture

post.description: Voids the PayPal authorization and sets the state of the Shopware order transaction accordingly

parameters.name: orderTransactionId
parameters.description: ID of the order transaction which contains the PayPal payment

204.description: Returns status 204 if the voidance was succesful

get.description: Loads the Payment details of the given PayPal ID

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: ID of the order which contains the PayPal payment

get.description: Loads the PayPal resource details of the given resource ID

parameters.name: resourceType
parameters.description: Type of the resource. Possible values: sale, authorization, order, capture, refund

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: ID of the order which contains the PayPal resource

get.summary: Download a document
get.description: Download a document by its identifier and deep link code.

parameters.name: documentId
parameters.description: Identifier of the document to be downloaded.

parameters.name: deepLinkCode
parameters.description: A unique hash code which was generated when the document was created.

parameters.name: download
parameters.description: This parameter controls the `Content-Disposition` header. If set to `true` the header will be set to `attachment` else `inline`.

post.summary: Create a document for an order
post.description: Creates a document for an order. A document can for example be an invoice or a delivery note.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: Identifier of the order the document should be generated for

parameters.name: documentTypeName
parameters.description: `technicalName` of the document type. Available types can be fetched with the `/api/document-type` endpoint.

parameters.name: fileType
parameters.description: Filetype of the document beeing created

config.description: Additional configuration. At least a unique `documentNumber` should be provided

documentNumber.description: A unique incremental number for the document. The `api.action.number-range.reserve` route can be used to fetch a free number. The type parameter for that route should match the document type, for example `document_invoice`, check the `number_range_type` entity for more types.

static.description: Static has to be set to `true` if a custom document is uploaded. This prevents the generation of a document and links to the uploaded media file

200.description: Document created successfully. The `api/_action/document/{documentId}/{deepLinkCode}` route can be used to download the document.

documentDeepLink.description: A unique hash code which is required to open the document.

post.summary: Upload a file for a document
post.description:
Uploads a file for a document. This prevents the document from beeing dynamically generated and delivers the uploaded file instead, when the document is downloaded.

Note:
* The document is required to be `static`
* A document can only have one media file

The are two methods of providing a file to this route:
 * Use a typical file upload and provide the file in the request
 * Fetch the file from an url. This only works if the `shopware.media.enable_url_upload_feature` variable is set to true in the shop environment.
To use file upload via url, the content type has to be `application/json` and the parameter `url` has to be provided.

parameters.name: documentId
parameters.description: Identifier of the document the new file should be added to.

parameters.name: extension
parameters.description: Extension of the uploaded file. For example `pdf`

url.description: The url of the document that will be downloaded.

documentDeepLink.description: A unique hash code which is required to open the document.

post.summary: Transition an order to a new state
post.description: Changes the order state and informs the customer via email if configured.

parameters.name: transition
parameters.description:
The `action_name` of the `state_machine_transition`. For example `process` if the order state should change from open to in progress.

Note: If you choose a transition that is not available, you will get an error that lists possible transitions for the current state.

sendMail.description: Controls if a mail should be sent to the customer.

documentIds.description: A list of document identifiers that should be attached

mediaIds.description: A list of media identifiers that should be attached

stateFieldName.description: This is the state column within the order database table. There should be no need to change it from the default.

post.summary: Transition an order transaction to a new state
post.description: Changes the order transaction state and informs the customer via email if configured.

parameters.name: transition
parameters.description:
The `action_name` of the `state_machine_transition`. For example `process` if the order state should change from open to in progress.

Note: If you choose a transition that is not available, you will get an error that lists possible transitions for the current state.

sendMail.description: Controls if a mail should be sent to the customer.

documentIds.description: A list of document identifiers that should be attached

mediaIds.description: A list of media identifiers that should be attached

stateFieldName.description: This is the state column within the order transaction database table. There should be no need to change it from the default.

200.description: Returns information about the transition that was made. `#/components/schemas/StateMachineTransition`

post.summary: Transition an order delivery to a new state
post.description: Changes the order delivery state and informs the customer via email if configured.

parameters.name: transition
parameters.description:
The `action_name` of the `state_machine_transition`. For example `process` if the order state should change from open to in progress.

Note: If you choose a transition which is not possible, you will get an error that lists possible transition for the actual state.

sendMail.description: Controls if a mail should be send to the customer.

documentIds.description: A list of document identifiers that should be attached

mediaIds.description: A list of media identifiers that should be attached

stateFieldName.description: This is the state column within the order delivery database table. There should be no need to change it from the default.

post.summary: Send a mail
post.description:
Generates a mail from a mail template and sends it to the customer.

Take a look at the `salesChannel` entity for possible values. For example `{{ salesChannel.name }}` can be used.

recipients.description: A list of recipients with name and mail address.

salesChannelId.description: Identifier of the sales channel from which the mail should be send.

contentHtml.description: The content of the mail in HTML format.

contentPlain.description: The content of the mail as plain text.

senderEmail.description: Mail address of the sender. If not set, `core.basicInformation.email` or `core.mailerSettings.senderAddress` will be used from the shop configuration.

mediaIds.description: List of media identifiers which should be attached to the mail.

binAttachments.description: A list of binary attachments which should be added to the mail.

recipientsBcc.description: A list of recipients with name and mail address to be set in BCC.

recipientsCc.description: A list of recipients with name and mail address to be set in CC.

replyTo.description: A list of mail addresses with name and mail address to be set in reply to.

returnPath.description: A list of mail addresses with name and mail address to be set in return path.

post.summary: Validate a mail content
post.description: Validates if content for a mail can be rendered without sending an email.

contentHtml.description: The content of the mail in HTML format.

contentPlain.description: The content of the mail as plain text.

204.description: Returns a no content response indicating the mail content was rendered successfully.

post.summary: Preview a mail template
post.description: Generates a preview of a mail template.

mailTemplateType.description: Only the property `templateData` is used. It provides additional variables to the templating engine.

templateData.description: An associative array that is handed over to the templating engine and can be used as variables in the mail content.

example.messageOfTheDay: An apple a day keeps the doctor away!

mailTemplate.description: The content of the mail as plain text.

contentHtml.description: The content of mail mail template in html format.
contentHtml.example: Hello {{ order.customerName }}, this is example mail content, the current date is {{ 'now'|date('d/m/Y') }}

200.description: The rendered preview of the mail template.

post.summary: Upload a file to a media entity
post.description:
Adds a new file to a media entity. If the entity has an existing file, it will be replaced.

The are two methods of providing a file to this route:
 * Use a typical file upload and provide the file in the request
 * Fetch the file from an url. This only works if the `shopware.media.enable_url_upload_feature` variable is set to true in the shop environment.
To use file upload via url, the content type has to be `application/json` and the parameter `url` has to be provided.

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: Name of the uploaded file. If not provided the media identifier will be used as name

parameters.name: extension
parameters.description: Extension of the uploaded file. For example `png`

url.description: The url of the media file that will be downloaded.

Location.description: Contains the url to the uploaded media for a redirect.

post.summary: Fetch an access token
post.description: Fetch a access token that can be used to perform authenticated requests

schema.description: For more information take a look at the [Authentication documentation](https://shopware.stoplight.io/docs/admin-api/docs/concepts/authentication-authorisation.md).

grant_type.description: The grant type that should be used. See [OAuth 2.0 grant](https://oauth2.thephpleague.com/authorization-server/which-grant/) for more information.

access_token.description: The access token that can be used for subsequent requests

get.description: Get information about the cache configuration

post.summary: Run indexer
post.description: Runs all registered indexer in the shop asynchronously.

skip.description: Array of indexers/updaters to be skipped.

204.description: Returns a no content response indicating that the indexing progress startet.

delete.description: After the cache has been cleared, new cache entries are generated asynchronously.

204.description: Returns a no content response indicating that the cache has been cleared and generation of new cache has started.

delete.description: The cache is immediately cleared synchronously for all used adapters.

204.description: Returns a no content response indicating that the cache has been cleared.

delete.description: Removes cache folders that are not needed anymore.

204.description: Returns a no content response indicating that the cleanup finished.

delete.description: The container cache is immediately cleared synchronously.

204.description: Returns a no content response indicating that the container cache is cleared.

post.summary: Run indexer
post.description: Runs all registered indexer in the shop asynchronously.

200.description: Returns an empty response indicating that the indexing process started.

post.summary: Iterate an indexer
post.description:
Starts a defined indexer with an offset.

for the next request. `finish: true` in the response indicates that the indexer is finished

parameters.name: indexer
parameters.description: Name of the indexer to iterate.

finish.description: Indicates if the indexing process finished.

offset.description: Offset to be used for the next iteration.

post.summary: Send product indexing message
post.description: Dispachtes an product indexing message to the message bus, with the provided ids

204.description: Returns an empty response indicating that the message dispatched.

get.description: Get information about the API in OpenAPI format.

200.description: Returns a list of about the business events.

get.summary: Get API information
Get the Shopware version
get.description: Get the version of the Shopware instance

200.description: Returns the version of the Shopware instance.

get.summary: Get actions for flow builder
get.description: Get a list of action for flow builder.

200.description: Returns a list of action for flow builder.

post.summary: Bulk edit entities
post.description:
Starts a sync process for the list of provided actions. This can be inserts, upserts, updates and deletes on different entities.

to an asynchronous process in the background. You can control the behaviour with the `single-operation` and `indexing-behavior` header.

parameters.name: fail-on-error
parameters.description: To continue upcoming actions on errors, set the `fail-on-error` header to `false`.

parameters.name: single-operation
parameters.description:
Controls weather the data is written at once or in seperate transactions.
- `true`: Data will be written in a single transaction

parameters.name: indexing-behavior
parameters.description:
Controls the indexing behavior.
- `disable-indexing`: Data indexing is completely disabled

action.description:
The action indicates what should happen with the provided payload.
* `upsert`: The Sync API does not differ between create and update operations,
but always performs an upsert operation. During an upsert, the system checks whether the entity already exists in the
system and updates it if an identifier has been passed, otherwise a new entity is created with this identifier.
* `delete`: Deletes entites with the provided identifiers

entity.description: The entity that should be processed with the payload.

payload.description:
Contains a list of changesets for an entity. If the action type is `delete`,
a list of identifiers can be provided.

200.description: Returns a sync result containing information about the updated entities

data.description: Object with information about the updated entites

success.description: Indicator if the sync was successful.

post.summary: Consume messages from the message queue.
post.description:
This route can be used to consume messenges from the message queue. It is intended to be used if
no cronjob is configured to consume messages regulary.

receiver.description:
The name of the transport in the messenger that should be processed.
See the [Symfony Messenger documentation](https://symfony.com/doc/current/messenger.html) for more information

post.summary: Run scheduled tasks.
post.description: Starts the scheduled task worker to handle the next scheduled tasks.

200.description: Returns a success message indicating a successful run.

get.summary: Get the minimum schedules task interval
get.description: Fetches the smallest interval that a scheduled task uses.

post.summary: Sync migrations to the database
post.description: Reads all migrations of the provided bundle name and inserts them to the `migration` database table.

identifier.description: Name of the bundle whose migrations are to be synced.

204.description: Returns a no content response indicating a successful sync.

post.summary: Execute migrations
post.description: Executes all migrations for the provided bundle name.

identifier.description: Name of the bundle whose migrations are to be synced.

limit.description: Limit the amout of migrations to be executed. By default, there is no limit.

until.description:
A timestamp that controls until which `creation_date` migrations are executed.
By default, all migrations are executed.

204.description: Returns a no content response indicating a successful sync.

post.summary: Execute destructive migrations
post.description: Executes all destructive migrations for the provided bundle name.

identifier.description: Name of the bundle whose migrations are to be synced.

mode.description:
The mode defines what type of migrations are executed.
* Possible values:
* `all`: Execute all migrations
* `blue-green`: Blue-green safe
    * update from 6.a.* to 6.(a+1).0 -> migrations for major 6.a are NOT executed
    * rollback from 6.(a+1).0 to 6.a.* is still possible
    * update from 6.(a+1).0 to 6.(a+1).1 or higher - migrations for major 6.a are executed
    * rollback possible from 6.(a+1).1 to 6.(a+1).0 possible
    * but rollback to 6.a.* not possible anymore!
* `safe`: Executing the migrations of the penultimate major. This should always be safe

limit.description: Limit the amout of migrations to be executed. By default, there is no limit.

until.description:
A timestamp that controls until which `creation_date` migrations are executed.
    By default, all migrations are executed.

204.description: Returns a no content response indicating a successful sync.

get.summary: Reserve or preview a document number
get.description:
This endpoint provides functionality to reserve or preview a document number which can be used to create a new document using the `/_action/order/{orderId}/document/{documentTypeName}` endpoint.

The number generated by the endpoint will be reserved and the number pointer will be incremented with every call. For preview purposes, you can add the `?preview=1` parameter to the request. In that case, the number will not be incremented.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: `technicalName` of the document type (e.g. `document_invoice`). Available types can be fetched with the `/api/document-type endpoint`.

parameters.name: saleschannel
parameters.description: Sales channel for the number range. Number ranges can be defined per sales channel, so you can pass a sales channel ID here.

parameters.name: preview
parameters.description: If this parameter has a true value, the number will not actually be incremented, but only previewed.

scope.description:
Scopes expressed in the form of resource URL endpoints. The value of the scope parameter
is expressed as a list of space-delimited, case-sensitive strings.

accessToken.description:
The access token issued by PayPal. After the access token
expires (see $expiresIn), you must request a new access token.

tokenType.description:
The type of the token issued as described in OAuth2.0 RFC6749,
Section 7.1. Value is case insensitive.

expiresIn.description: The lifetime of the access token, in seconds.

addressLine_1.description:
The first line of the address. For example, number or street. For example, 173 Drury Lane.
Required for data entry and compliance and risk checks. Must contain the full address.

addressLine_2.description: The second line of the address. For example, suite or apartment number.

adminArea_2.description: A city, town, or village. Smaller than $adminArea1

adminArea_1.description:
The highest level sub-division in a country, which is usually a province, state, or ISO-3166-2 subdivision.
Format for postal delivery. For example, CA and not California.

links.description: Link members related to the primary data.

included.description: To reduce the number of HTTP requests, servers **MAY** allow responses that include related resources along with the requested primary resources. Such responses are called "compound documents".

meta.description: Non-standard meta-information that can not be represented as an attribute or relationship.

data.description: The document's "primary data" is a representation of the resource or collection of resources targeted by a request.

oneOf.description: An array of resource objects, an array of resource identifier objects, or an empty array ([]), for requests that target resource collections.

resource.description: "Resource objects" appear in a JSON API document to represent resources.

relationshipLinks.description: A resource object **MAY** contain references to other resource objects ("relationships"). Relationships may be to-one or to-many. Relationships can be specified by including a member in a resource's links object.

allOf.description: A `self` member, whose value is a URL for the relationship itself (a "relationship URL"). This URL allows the client to directly manipulate the relationship. For example, it would allow a client to remove an `author` from an `article` without deleting the people resource itself.

link.description: A link **MUST** be represented as either: a string containing the link's URL or a link object.

oneOf.description: A string containing the link's URL.

href.description: A string containing the link's URL.

attributes.description: Members of the attributes object ("attributes") represent information about the resource object in which it's defined.

relationships.description: Members of the relationships object ("relationships") represent references from the resource object in which it's defined to other resource objects.

allOf.description: References to other resource objects in a to-one ("relationship"). Relationships can be specified by including a member in a resource's links object.

relationshipToMany.description: An array of objects each containing \"type\" and \"id\" members for to-many relationships.

jsonapi.description: An object describing the server's implementation

id.description: A unique identifier for this particular occurrence of the problem.

status.description: The HTTP status code applicable to this problem, expressed as a string value.

code.description: An application-specific error code, expressed as a string value.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem. It **SHOULD NOT** change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

pointer.description: A JSON Pointer [RFC6901] to the associated entity in the request document [e.g. "/data" for a primary data object, or "/data/attributes/title" for a specific attribute].

parameter.description: A string indicating which query parameter caused the error.

aware.description: Flow builder will base on awareness to show actions

requirements.description: When requirement fit with aware from `events.json` actions will be shown
